title: Logo Font ID
content:
Can anyone tell me what these fonts are? Thanks!

| Attachment | Size |
| --- | --- |
| [ws.JPG](http://web.archive.org/web/20131018035852/http:/typophile.com/files/ws.JPG) | 38.95 KB |
author: tflavin

comments.content: Futura(esqe), but seriously mistreated. I don't have Futura, so I can't replicate your sample. If you don't have it either, you can use Twentieth Century (TW Cen MT on Windows machines) as a substitute.

I tried to put this together, and it does seem like West and Star are in Futura, but then Mortgage couldn't be Futura with the two story a - so I think maybe helvetica?

 ![](http://web.archive.org/web/20131018035852im_/http:/typophile.com/files/ws_type_6533.gif)

Nah, that isn't Helvetica. Look at the bowl of the "a". Or the top of the "t".  
Univers (57 Condensed, and then additionally [squooshed](http://web.archive.org/web/20131018035852/http:/typophile.com/wiki/squooshed)) seems closer, but isn't quite "it" either.
